English: And the name of the other was Eliezer; for the God of my father, said he, was mine help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh:

English: And Moses went out to meet his father in law, and did obeisance, and kissed him; and they asked each other of their welfare; and they came into the tent.

Hebrew: וַיְסַפֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ לְחֹ֣תְנ֔וֹ אֵת֩ כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה יְהוָה֙ לְפַרְעֹ֣ה וּלְמִצְרַ֔יִם עַ֖ל אוֹדֹ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֵ֤ת כָּל־הַתְּלָאָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מְצָאָ֣תַם בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ וַיַּצִּלֵ֖ם יְהוָֽה׃

English: And Moses told his father in law all that the LORD had done unto Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel's sake, and all the travail that had come upon them by the way, and how the LORD delivered them.

English: And Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which the LORD had done to Israel, whom he had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.

English: Now I know that the LORD is greater than all gods: for in the thing wherein they dealt proudly he was above them.

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח יִתְר֨וֹ חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֛ה עֹלָ֥ה וּזְבָחִ֖ים לֵֽאלֹהִ֑ים וַיָּבֹ֨א אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְכֹ֣ל זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֶאֱכָל־לֶ֛חֶם עִם־חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃

English: And Jethro, Moses' father in law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God: and Aaron came, and all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses' father in law before God.

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ מִֽמָּחֳרָ֔ת וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב מֹשֶׁ֖ה לִשְׁפֹּ֣ט אֶת־הָעָ֑ם וַיַּעֲמֹ֤ד הָעָם֙ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה מִן־הַבֹּ֖קֶר עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃

English: And when Moses' father in law saw all that he did to the people, he said, What is this thing that thou doest to the people? why sittest thou thyself alone, and all the people stand by thee from morning unto even?

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֨ה לָהֶ֤ם דָּבָר֙ בָּ֣א אֵלַ֔י וְשָׁ֣פַטְתִּ֔י בֵּ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ וּבֵ֣ין רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְהוֹדַעְתִּ֛י אֶת־חֻקֵּ֥י הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים וְאֶת־תּוֹרֹתָֽיו׃
Translit: kî-yihyeh låhem dåvår båʾ ʾēlai vəshåfaṭtî bēn ʾîsh ūvēn rēʿēhū vəhōdhaʿtî ʾeth-ḥuqqē håʾelōhîm vəʾeth-tōrōthåv-
English: When they have a matter, they come unto me; and I judge between one and another, and I do make them know the statutes of God, and his laws.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר חֹתֵ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֵלָ֑יו לֹא־טוֹב֙ הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֖ה עֹשֶֽׂה׃

Hebrew: נָבֹ֣ל תִּבֹּ֔ל גַּם־אַתָּ֕ה גַּם־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמָּ֑ךְ כִּֽי־כָבֵ֤ד מִמְּךָ֙ הַדָּבָ֔ר לֹא־תוּכַ֥ל עֲשֹׂ֖הוּ לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃

English: Thou wilt surely wear away, both thou, and this people that is with thee: for this thing is too heavy for thee; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone.

Translit: ʿattåh shəmaʿ bəqōlî ʾîʿåtṣkhå vîhî ʾelōhîm ʿimmåkh heyēh ʾattåh låʿåm mūl håʾelōhîm vəhēvēʾthå ʾattåh ʾeth-haddəvårîm ʾel-håʾelōhîm
English: Hearken now unto my voice, I will give thee counsel, and God shall be with thee: Be thou for the people to God-ward, that thou mayest bring the causes unto God:

Hebrew: וְהִזְהַרְתָּ֣ה אֶתְהֶ֔ם אֶת־הַחֻקִּ֖ים וְאֶת־הַתּוֹרֹ֑ת וְהוֹדַעְתָּ֣ לָהֶ֗ם אֶת־הַדֶּ֨רֶךְ֙ יֵ֣לְכוּ בָ֔הּ וְאֶת־הַֽמַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲשֽׂוּן׃
Translit: vəhizhartåh ʾethhem ʾeth-haḥuqqîm vəʾeth-hattōrōth vəhōdhaʿtå låhem ʾeth-hadderekh yēləkhū våhh vəʾeth-hammaʿaseh ʾasher yaʿasūn
English: And thou shalt teach them ordinances and laws, and shalt shew them the way wherein they must walk, and the work that they must do.

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה תֶחֱזֶ֣ה מִכָּל־הָ֠עָם אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֜יִל יִרְאֵ֧י אֱלֹהִ֛ים אַנְשֵׁ֥י אֱמֶ֖ת שֹׂ֣נְאֵי בָ֑צַע וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ עֲלֵהֶ֗ם שָׂרֵ֤י אֲלָפִים֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מֵא֔וֹת שָׂרֵ֥י חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֥י עֲשָׂרֹֽת׃
Translit: vəʾattåh theḥezeh mikkål-håʿåm ʾanshē-ḥayil yirʾē ʾelōhîm ʾanshē ʾemeth sōnəʾē våtṣaʿ vəsamtå ʿalēhem sårē ʾalåfîm sårē mēʾōth sårē ḥamisshîm vəsårē ʿasårōth
English: Moreover thou shalt provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating covetousness; and place such over them, to be rulers of thousands, and rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens:

Translit: vəshåfṭū ʾeth-håʿåm bəkhål-ʿēth vəhåyåh kål-haddåvår haggådhōl yåvîʾū ʾēlekhå vəkhål-haddåvår haqqåṭōn yishpəṭū-hēm vəhåqēl mēʿålekhå vənåsʾū ʾittåkh
English: And let them judge the people at all seasons: and it shall be, that every great matter they shall bring unto thee, but every small matter they shall judge: so shall it be easier for thyself, and they shall bear the burden with thee.

Hebrew: אִ֣ם אֶת־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְצִוְּךָ֣ אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְיָֽכָלְתָּ֖ עֲמֹ֑ד וְגַם֙ כָּל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה עַל־מְקֹמ֖וֹ יָבֹ֥א בְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translit: ʾim ʾeth-haddåvår hazzeh taʿaseh vətṣivvəkhå ʾelōhîm vəyåkhåltå ʿamōdh vəgham kål-håʿåm hazzeh ʿal-məqōmō yåvōʾ vəshålōm
English: If thou shalt do this thing, and God command thee so, then thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people shall also go to their place in peace.

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע מֹשֶׁ֖ה לְק֣וֹל חֹתְנ֑וֹ וַיַּ֕עַשׂ כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָמָֽר׃
Translit: vayyishmaʿ mōsheh ləqōl ḥōthənō vayyaʿas kōl ʾasher ʾåmår
English: So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father in law, and did all that he had said.

Hebrew: וַיִּבְחַ֨ר מֹשֶׁ֤ה אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֨יִל֙ מִכָּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛ם רָאשִׁ֖ים עַל־הָעָ֑ם שָׂרֵ֤י אֲלָפִים֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מֵא֔וֹת שָׂרֵ֥י חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֥י עֲשָׂרֹֽת׃
Translit: vayyivḥar mōsheh ʾanshē-ḥayil mikkål-yisråʾēl vayyittēn ʾōthåm råʾshîm ʿal-håʿåm sårē ʾalåfîm sårē mēʾōth sårē ḥamisshîm vəsårē ʿasårōth
English: And Moses chose able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people, rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.

Hebrew: וְשָׁפְט֥וּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם בְּכָל־עֵ֑ת אֶת־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַקָּשֶׁה֙ יְבִיא֣וּן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְכָל־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַקָּטֹ֖ן יִשְׁפּוּט֥וּ הֵֽם׃
Translit: vəshåfṭū ʾeth-håʿåm bəkhål-ʿēth ʾeth-haddåvår haqqåsheh yəvîʾūn ʾel-mōsheh vəkhål-haddåvår haqqåṭōn yishpūṭū hēm
English: And they judged the people at all seasons: the hard causes they brought unto Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶת־חֹתְנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ ל֖וֹ אֶל־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayshallaḥ mōsheh ʾeth-ḥōthənō vayyēlekh lō ʾel-ʾartṣō
English: And Moses let his father in law depart; and he went his way into his own land.

Hebrew: בַּחֹ֨דֶשׁ֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י לְצֵ֥את בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם בַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה בָּ֖אוּ מִדְבַּ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
Translit: baḥōdhesh hasshəlîshî lətṣēʾth bənē-yisråʾēl mēʾeretṣ mitṣråyim bayyōm hazzeh båʾū midhbar sînåi
English: In the third month, when the children of Israel were gone forth out of the land of Egypt, the same day came they into the wilderness of Sinai.

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֣וּ מֵרְפִידִ֗ים וַיָּבֹ֨אוּ֙ מִדְבַּ֣ר סִינַ֔י וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַיִּֽחַן־שָׁ֥ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נֶ֥גֶד הָהָֽר׃
Translit: vayyisʿū mērəfîdhîm vayyåvōʾū midhbar sînai vayyaḥanū bammidhbår vayyiḥan-shåm yisråʾēl neghedh håhår
English: For they were departed from Rephidim, and were come to the desert of Sinai, and had pitched in the wilderness; and there Israel camped before the mount.

Hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁ֥ה עָלָ֖ה אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֵלָ֤יו יְהוָה֙ מִן־הָהָ֣ר לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֤ה תֹאמַר֙ לְבֵ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְתַגֵּ֖יד לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translit: ūmōsheh ʿålåh ʾel-håʾelōhîm vayyiqråʾ ʾēlåv ʾadhōnåi min-håhår lēʾmōr kōh thōʾmar ləvēth yaʿaqōv vəthaggēdh livnē yisråʾēl
English: And Moses went up unto God, and the LORD called unto him out of the mountain, saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel;

Hebrew: אַתֶּ֣ם רְאִיתֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתִי לְמִצְרָ֑יִם וָאֶשָּׂ֤א אֶתְכֶם֙ עַל־כַּנְפֵ֣י נְשָׁרִ֔ים וָאָבִ֥א אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃
Translit: ʾattem rəʾîthem ʾasher ʿåsîthî ləmitṣråyim våʾessåʾ ʾethkhem ʿal-kanfē nəshårîm våʾåviʾ ʾethkhem ʾēlåi
English: Ye have seen what I did unto the Egyptians, and how I bare you on eagles' wings, and brought you unto myself.

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה אִם־שָׁמ֤וֹעַ תִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ בְּקֹלִ֔י וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֑י וִהְיִ֨יתֶם לִ֤י סְגֻלָּה֙ מִכָּל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים כִּי־לִ֖י כָּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translit: vəʿattåh ʾim-shåmōaʿ tishməʿū bəqōlî ūshəmartem ʾeth-bərîthî vihyîthem lî səghullåh mikkål-håʿammîm kî-lî kål-håʾåretṣ
English: Now therefore, if ye will obey my voice indeed, and keep my covenant, then ye shall be a peculiar treasure unto me above all people: for all the earth is mine:

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֧ם תִּהְיוּ־לִ֛י מַמְלֶ֥כֶת כֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְג֣וֹי קָד֑וֹשׁ אֵ֚לֶּה הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּדַבֵּ֖ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translit: vəʾattem tihyū-lî mamlekheth kōhanîm vəghōy qådhōsh ʾēlleh haddəvårîm ʾasher tədhabbēr ʾel-bənē yisråʾēl
English: And ye shall be unto me a kingdom of priests, and an holy nation. These are the words which thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel.

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיִּקְרָ֖א לְזִקְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וַיָּ֣שֶׂם לִפְנֵיהֶ֗ם אֵ֚ת כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖הוּ יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: vayyåvōʾ mōsheh vayyiqråʾ ləziqnē håʿåm vayyåsem lifnēhem ʾēth kål-haddəvårîm håʾēlleh ʾasher tṣivvåhū ʾadhōnåi
English: And Moses came and called for the elders of the people, and laid before their faces all these words which the LORD commanded him.

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲנ֨וּ כָל־הָעָ֤ם יַחְדָּו֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה נַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וַיָּ֧שֶׁב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם אֶל־יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: vayyaʿanū khål-håʿåm yaḥdåv vayyōʾmərū kōl ʾasher-dibber ʾadhōnåi naʿaseh vayyåshev mōsheh ʾeth-divrē håʿåm ʾel-ʾadhōnåi
English: And all the people answered together, and said, All that the LORD hath spoken we will do. And Moses returned the words of the people unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י בָּ֣א אֵלֶיךָ֮ בְּעַ֣ב הֶֽעָנָן֒ בַּעֲב֞וּר יִשְׁמַ֤ע הָעָם֙ בְּדַבְּרִ֣י עִמָּ֔ךְ וְגַם־בְּךָ֖ יַאֲמִ֣ינוּ לְעוֹלָ֑ם וַיַּגֵּ֥ד מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם אֶל־יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh hinnēh ʾånōkhî båʾ ʾēlekhå bəʿav heʿånån baʿavūr yishmaʿ håʿåm bədhabbərî ʿimmåkh vəgham-bəkhå yaʾamînū ləʿōlåm vayyaggēdh mōsheh ʾeth-divrē håʿåm ʾel-ʾadhōnåi
English: And the LORD said unto Moses, Lo, I come unto thee in a thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with thee, and believe thee for ever. And Moses told the words of the people unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ לֵ֣ךְ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ם הַיּ֖וֹם וּמָחָ֑ר וְכִבְּס֖וּ שִׂמְלֹתָֽם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh lēkh ʾel-håʿåm vəqiddashtåm hayyōm ūmåḥår vəkhibbəsū simlōthåm
English: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go unto the people, and sanctify them to day and to morrow, and let them wash their clothes,

Hebrew: וְהָי֥וּ נְכֹנִ֖ים לַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י כִּ֣י בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֗י יֵרֵ֧ד יְהוָ֛ה לְעֵינֵ֥י כָל־הָעָ֖ם עַל־הַ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
Translit: vəhåiū nəkhōnîm layyōm hasshəlîshî kî bayyōm hasshəlîshî yērēdh ʾadhōnåi ləʿēnē khål-håʿåm ʿal-har sînåi
English: And be ready against the third day: for the third day the LORD will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai.

Hebrew: וְהִגְבַּלְתָּ֤ אֶת־הָעָם֙ סָבִ֣יב לֵאמֹ֔ר הִשָּׁמְר֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם עֲל֥וֹת בָּהָ֖ר וּנְגֹ֣עַ בְּקָצֵ֑הוּ כָּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּהָ֖ר מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translit: vəhighbaltå ʾeth-håʿåm såvîv lēʾmōr hisshåmrū låkhem ʿalōth båhår ūnəghōaʿ bəqåtṣēhū kål-hannōghēaʿ båhår mōth yūmåth
English: And thou shalt set bounds unto the people round about, saying, Take heed to yourselves, that ye go not up into the mount, or touch the border of it: whosoever toucheth the mount shall be surely put to death:

Hebrew: לֹא־תִגַּ֨ע בּ֜וֹ יָ֗ד כִּֽי־סָק֤וֹל יִסָּקֵל֙ אוֹ־יָרֹ֣ה יִיָּרֶ֔ה אִם־בְּהֵמָ֥ה אִם־אִ֖ישׁ לֹ֣א יִחְיֶ֑ה בִּמְשֹׁךְ֙ הַיֹּבֵ֔ל הֵ֖מָּה יַעֲל֥וּ בָהָֽר׃
Translit: lōʾ-thiggaʿ bō yådh kî-såqōl yissåqēl ʾō-yårōh yiyyåreh ʾim-bəhēmåh ʾim-ʾîsh lōʾ yiḥyeh bimshōkh hayyōvēl hēmmåh yaʿalū våhår-
English: There shall not an hand touch it, but he shall surely be stoned, or shot through; whether it be beast or man, it shall not live: when the trumpet soundeth long, they shall come up to the mount.

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧רֶד מֹשֶׁ֛ה מִן־הָהָ֖ר אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וַיְקַדֵּשׁ֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וַֽיְכַבְּס֖וּ שִׂמְלֹתָֽם׃
Translit: vayyēredh mōsheh min-håhår ʾel-håʿåm vayqaddēsh ʾeth-håʿåm vaykhabbəsū simlōthåm
English: And Moses went down from the mount unto the people, and sanctified the people; and they washed their clothes.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם הֱי֥וּ נְכֹנִ֖ים לִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים אַֽל־תִּגְּשׁ֖וּ אֶל־אִשָּֽׁה׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾel-håʿåm heū nəkhōnîm lishlōsheth yåmîm ʾal-tiggəshū ʾel-ʾisshåh
English: And he said unto the people, Be ready against the third day: come not at your wives.

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֜י בִּֽהְיֹ֣ת הַבֹּ֗קֶר וַיְהִי֩ קֹלֹ֨ת וּבְרָקִ֜ים וְעָנָ֤ן כָּבֵד֙ עַל־הָהָ֔ר וְקֹ֥ל שֹׁפָ֖ר חָזָ֣ק מְאֹ֑ד וַיֶּחֱרַ֥ד כָּל־הָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translit: vayhî vayyōm hasshəlîshî bihyōth habbōqer vayhî qōlōth ūvəråqîm vəʿånån kåvēdh ʿal-håhår vəqōl shōfår ḥåzåq məʾōdh vayyeḥeradh kål-håʿåm ʾasher bammaḥaneh
English: And it came to pass on the third day in the morning, that there were thunders and lightnings, and a thick cloud upon the mount, and the voice of the trumpet exceeding loud; so that all the people that was in the camp trembled.

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵ֨א מֹשֶׁ֧ה אֶת־הָעָ֛ם לִקְרַ֥את הָֽאֱלֹהִ֖ים מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וַיִּֽתְיַצְּב֖וּ בְּתַחְתִּ֥ית הָהָֽר׃
Translit: vayyōtṣēʾ mōsheh ʾeth-håʿåm liqraʾth håʾelōhîm min-hammaḥaneh vayyithyatṣṣəvū bəthaḥtîth håhår
English: And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet with God; and they stood at the nether part of the mount.

Hebrew: וְהַ֤ר סִינַי֙ עָשַׁ֣ן כֻּלּ֔וֹ מִ֠פְּנֵי אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרַ֥ד עָלָ֛יו יְהוָ֖ה בָּאֵ֑שׁ וַיַּ֤עַל עֲשָׁנוֹ֙ כְּעֶ֣שֶׁן הַכִּבְשָׁ֔ן וַיֶּחֱרַ֥ד כָּל־הָהָ֖ר מְאֹֽד׃
Translit: vəhar sînai ʿåshan kullō mippənē ʾasher yåradh ʿålåv ʾadhōnåi båʾēsh vayyaʿal ʿashånō kəʿeshen hakkivshån vayyeḥeradh kål-håhår məʾōdh
English: And mount Sinai was altogether on a smoke, because the LORD descended upon it in fire: and the smoke thereof ascended as the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mount quaked greatly.

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ ק֣וֹל הַשּׁוֹפָ֔ר הוֹלֵ֖ךְ וְחָזֵ֣ק מְאֹ֑ד מֹשֶׁ֣ה יְדַבֵּ֔ר וְהָאֱלֹהִ֖ים יַעֲנֶ֥נּוּ בְקֽוֹל׃
Translit: vayhî qōl hasshōfår hōlēkh vəḥåzēq məʾōdh mōsheh yədhabbēr vəhåʾelōhîm yaʿanennū vəqōl
English: And when the voice of the trumpet sounded long, and waxed louder and louder, Moses spake, and God answered him by a voice.

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧רֶד יְהוָ֛ה עַל־הַ֥ר סִינַ֖י אֶל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֑ר וַיִּקְרָ֨א יְהוָ֧ה לְמֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָהָ֖ר וַיַּ֥עַל מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translit: vayyēredh ʾadhōnåi ʿal-har sînai ʾel-rōʾsh håhår vayyiqråʾ ʾadhōnåi ləmōsheh ʾel-rōʾsh håhår vayyaʿal mōsheh
English: And the LORD came down upon mount Sinai, on the top of the mount: and the LORD called Moses up to the top of the mount; and Moses went up.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה רֵ֖ד הָעֵ֣ד בָּעָ֑ם פֶּן־יֶהֶרְס֤וּ אֶל־יְהוָה֙ לִרְא֔וֹת וְנָפַ֥ל מִמֶּ֖נּוּ רָֽב׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh rēdh håʿēdh båʿåm pen-yehersū ʾel-ʾadhōnåi lirʾōth vənåfal mimmennū råv
English: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go down, charge the people, lest they break through unto the LORD to gaze, and many of them perish.

Hebrew: וְגַ֧ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֛ים הַנִּגָּשִׁ֥ים אֶל־יְהוָ֖ה יִתְקַדָּ֑שׁוּ פֶּן־יִפְרֹ֥ץ בָּהֶ֖ם יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəgham hakkōhanîm hanniggåshîm ʾel-ʾadhōnåi yithqaddåshū pen-yifrōtṣ båhem ʾadhōnåi
English: And let the priests also, which come near to the LORD, sanctify themselves, lest the LORD break forth upon them.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה לֹא־יוּכַ֣ל הָעָ֔ם לַעֲלֹ֖ת אֶל־הַ֣ר סִינָ֑י כִּֽי־אַתָּ֞ה הַעֵדֹ֤תָה בָּ֨נוּ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הַגְבֵּ֥ל אֶת־הָהָ֖ר וְקִדַּשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh ʾel-ʾadhōnåi lōʾ-yūkhal håʿåm laʿalōth ʾel-har sînåi kî-ʾattåh haʿēdhōthåh bånū lēʾmōr haghbēl ʾeth-håhår vəqiddashtō
English: And Moses said unto the LORD, The people cannot come up to mount Sinai: for thou chargedst us, saying, Set bounds about the mount, and sanctify it.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֤יו יְהוָה֙ לֶךְ־רֵ֔ד וְעָלִ֥יתָ אַתָּ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֣ן עִמָּ֑ךְ וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהָעָ֗ם אַל־יֶֽהֶרְס֛וּ לַעֲלֹ֥ת אֶל־יְהוָ֖ה פֶּן־יִפְרָץ־בָּֽם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾēlåv ʾadhōnåi lekh-rēdh vəʿålîthå ʾattåh vəʾaharōn ʿimmåkh vəhakkōhanîm vəhåʿåm ʾal-yehersū laʿalōth ʾel-ʾadhōnåi pen-yifråtṣ-båm
English: And the LORD said unto him, Away, get thee down, and thou shalt come up, thou, and Aaron with thee: but let not the priests and the people break through to come up unto the LORD, lest he break forth upon them.

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥רֶד מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
Translit: vayyēredh mōsheh ʾel-håʿåm vayyōʾmer ʾalēhem
English: So Moses went down unto the people, and spake unto them.

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֵ֛ת כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vaydhabbēr ʾelōhîm ʾēth kål-haddəvårîm håʾēlleh lēʾmōr
English: And God spake all these words, saying,

Hebrew: אָֽנֹכִ֖י יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ אֲשֶׁ֧ר הוֹצֵאתִ֛יךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים
Translit: ʾånōkhî ʾadhōnåi ʾelōhekhå ʾasher hōtṣēʾthîkhå mēʾeretṣ mitṣrayim mibbēth ʿavådhîm
English: I am the LORD thy God, which have brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

Hebrew: לֹֽ֣א יִהְיֶֽה־לְךָ֛ אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים עַל־פָּנָֽיַ
Translit: lōʾ yihyeh-ləkhå ʾelōhîm ʾaḥērîm ʿal-pånåya
English: Thou shalt have no other gods before me.

Hebrew: לֹֽ֣א תַֽעֲשֶׂ֨ה־לְךָ֥ פֶ֨סֶל֙ וְכָל־תְּמוּנָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר בַּשָּׁמַ֨יִם֙ מִמַּ֔עַל וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּאָ֖רֶץ מִתָּ֑חַת וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּמַּ֖יִם מִתַּ֥חַת לָאָֽרֶץ
Translit: lōʾ thaʿaseh-ləkhå fesel vəkhål-təmūnåh ʾasher basshåmayim mimmaʿal vaʾasher båʾåretṣ mittåḥath vaʾasher bammayim mittaḥath låʾåretṣ
English: Thou shalt not make unto thee any graven image, or any likeness of any thing that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth:

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֣א תָעָבְדֵ֑ם כִּ֣י אָֽנֹכִ֞י יְהוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֨יךָ֙ אֵ֣ל קַנָּ֔א פֹּ֠קֵד עֲוֺ֨ן אָבֹ֧ת עַל־בָּנִ֛ים עַל־שִׁלֵּשִׁ֥ים וְעַל־רִבֵּעִ֖ים לְשֹׂנְאָֽי
Translit: lōʾ-thishtaḥaveh låhem vəlōʾ thåʿåvdhēm kî ʾånōkhî ʾadhōnåi ʾelōhekhå ʾēl qannåʾ pōqēdh ʿavōn ʾåvōth ʿal-bånîm ʿal-shillēshîm vəʿal-ribbēʿîm ləsōnəʾåi-
English: Thou shalt not bow down thyself to them, nor serve them: for I the LORD thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation of them that hate me;

Hebrew: וְעֹ֥שֶׂה חֶ֖סֶד לַאֲלָפִ֑ים לְאֹהֲבַ֖י וּלְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י מִצְוֺתָֽי׃
Translit: vəʿōseh ḥesedh laʾalåfîm ləʾōhavai ūləshōmərē mitṣvōthåi
English: And shewing mercy unto thousands of them that love me, and keep my commandments.

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תִשָּׂ֛א אֶת־שֵֽׁם־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לַשָּׁ֑וְא כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יְנַקֶּה֙ יְהוָ֔ה אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־יִשָּׂ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ לַשָּֽׁוְא׃
Translit: lōʾ thissåʾ ʾeth-shēm-ʾadhōnåi ʾelōhekhå lasshåvʾ kî lōʾ yənaqqeh ʾadhōnåi ʾēth ʾasher-yissåʾ ʾeth-shəmō lasshåvʾ
English: Thou shalt not take the name of the LORD thy God in vain; for the LORD will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain.

Hebrew: זָכ֛וֹר אֶת־י֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֖ת לְקַדְּשֽׁוֹ
Translit: zåkhōr ʾeth-yōm hasshabbåth ləqaddəshō
English: Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy.

Hebrew: שֵׁ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ תַּֽעֲבֹ֔ד וְעָשִׂ֖יתָ כָּל־מְלַאכְתֶּֽךָ
Translit: shēsheth yåmîm taʿavōdh vəʿåsîthå kål-məlaʾkhətekhå
English: Six days shalt thou labour, and do all thy work:

Hebrew: וְי֨וֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י שַׁבָּ֖ת לַיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לֹֽ֣א־תַעֲשֶׂ֨ה כָל־מְלָאכָ֜ה אַתָּ֣ה וּבִנְךָֽ֣־וּבִתֶּ֗ךָ עַבְדְּךָ֤ וַאֲמָֽתְךָ֙ וּבְהֶמְתֶּ֔ךָ וְגֵרְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ
Translit: vəyōm hasshəvîʿî shabbåth laʾdhōnåi ʾelōhekhå lōʾ-thaʿaseh khål-məlåʾkhåh ʾattåh ūvinkhå-ūvittekhå ʿavdəkhå vaʾamåthkhå ūvəhemtekhå vəghērəkhå ʾasher bishʿårekhå
English: But the seventh day is the sabbath of the LORD thy God: in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy manservant, nor thy maidservant, nor thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates:

Hebrew: כִּ֣י שֵֽׁשֶׁת־יָמִים֩ עָשָׂ֨ה יְהוָ֜ה אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם וְאֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֶת־הַיָּם֙ וְאֶת־כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֔ם וַיָּ֖נַח בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֑י עַל־כֵּ֗ן בֵּרַ֧ךְ יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־י֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֖ת וַֽיְקַדְּשֵֽׁהוּ׃
Translit: kî shēsheth-yåmîm ʿåsåh ʾadhōnåi ʾeth-hasshåmayim vəʾeth-håʾåretṣ ʾeth-hayyåm vəʾeth-kål-ʾasher-båm vayyånaḥ bayyōm hasshəvîʿî ʿal-kēn bērakh ʾadhōnåi ʾeth-yōm hasshabbåth vayqaddəshēhū
English: For in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seventh day: wherefore the LORD blessed the sabbath day, and hallowed it.

Hebrew: כַּבֵּ֥ד אֶת־אָבִ֖יךָ וְאֶת־אִמֶּ֑ךָ לְמַ֨עַן֙ יַאֲרִכ֣וּן יָמֶ֔יךָ עַ֚ל הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃
Translit: kabbēdh ʾeth-ʾåvîkhå vəʾeth-ʾimmekhå ləmaʿan yaʾarikhūn yåmekhå ʿal håʾadhåmåh ʾasher-ʾadhōnåi ʾelōhekhå nōthēn låkh
English: Honour thy father and thy mother: that thy days may be long upon the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.

Hebrew: לֹ֖א תִּרְצָֽח
Translit: lōʾ tirtṣåḥ
English: Thou shalt not kill.

Hebrew: לֹ֖א תִּנְאָֽף
Translit: lōʾ tinʾåf
English: Thou shalt not commit adultery.

Hebrew: לֹ֖א תִּגְנֹֽב
Translit: lōʾ tighnōv
English: Thou shalt not steal.

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תַעֲנֶ֥ה בְרֵעֲךָ֖ עֵ֥ד שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translit: lōʾ-thaʿaneh vərēʿakhå ʿēdh shåqer-
English: Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbour.

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תַחְמֹ֖ד בֵּ֣ית רֵעֶ֑ךָ לֹֽא־תַחְמֹ֞ד אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֶ֗ךָ וְעַבְדּ֤וֹ וַאֲמָתוֹ֙ וְשׁוֹר֣וֹ וַחֲמֹר֔וֹ וְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְרֵעֶֽךָ׃
Translit: lōʾ thaḥmōdh bēth rēʿekhå lōʾ-thaḥmōdh ʾēsheth rēʿekhå vəʿavdō vaʾamåthō vəshōrō vaḥamōrō vəkhōl ʾasher lərēʿekhå
English: Thou shalt not covet thy neighbour's house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbour's wife, nor his manservant, nor his maidservant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor any thing that is thy neighbour's.

Hebrew: וְכָל־הָעָם֩ רֹאִ֨ים אֶת־הַקּוֹלֹ֜ת וְאֶת־הַלַּפִּידִ֗ם וְאֵת֙ ק֣וֹל הַשֹּׁפָ֔ר וְאֶת־הָהָ֖ר עָשֵׁ֑ן וַיַּ֤רְא הָעָם֙ וַיָּנֻ֔עוּ וַיַּֽעַמְד֖וּ מֵֽרָחֹֽק׃
Translit: vəkhål-håʿåm rōʾîm ʾeth-haqqōlōth vəʾeth-hallappîdhim vəʾēth qōl hasshōfår vəʾeth-håhår ʿåshēn vayyarʾ håʿåm vayyånuʿū vayyaʿamdhū mēråḥōq-
English: And all the people saw the thunderings, and the lightnings, and the noise of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking: and when the people saw it, they removed, and stood afar off.

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה דַּבֵּר־אַתָּ֥ה עִמָּ֖נוּ וְנִשְׁמָ֑עָה וְאַל־יְדַבֵּ֥ר עִמָּ֛נוּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים פֶּן־נָמֽוּת׃
Translit: vayyōʾmərū ʾel-mōsheh dabbēr-ʾattåh ʿimmånū vənishmåʿåh vəʾal-yədhabbēr ʿimmånū ʾelōhîm pen-nåmūth
English: And they said unto Moses, Speak thou with us, and we will hear: but let not God speak with us, lest we die.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶל־הָעָם֮ אַל־תִּירָאוּ֒ כִּ֗י לְבַֽעֲבוּר֙ נַסּ֣וֹת אֶתְכֶ֔ם בָּ֖א הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וּבַעֲב֗וּר תִּהְיֶ֧ה יִרְאָת֛וֹ עַל־פְּנֵיכֶ֖ם לְבִלְתִּ֥י תֶחֱטָֽאוּ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh ʾel-håʿåm ʾal-tîråʾū kî ləvaʿavūr nassōth ʾethkhem båʾ håʾelōhîm ūvaʿavūr tihyeh yirʾåthō ʿal-pənēkhem ləviltî theḥeṭåʾū
English: And Moses said unto the people, Fear not: for God is come to prove you, and that his fear may be before your faces, that ye sin not.

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֥ד הָעָ֖ם מֵרָחֹ֑ק וּמֹשֶׁה֙ נִגַּ֣שׁ אֶל־הָֽעֲרָפֶ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translit: vayyaʿamōdh håʿåm mēråḥōq ūmōsheh niggash ʾel-håʿaråfel ʾasher-shåm håʾelōhîm
English: And the people stood afar off, and Moses drew near unto the thick darkness where God was.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֹּ֥ה תֹאמַ֖ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אַתֶּ֣ם רְאִיתֶ֔ם כִּ֚י מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי עִמָּכֶֽם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh kōh thōʾmar ʾel-bənē yisråʾēl ʾattem rəʾîthem kî min-hasshåmayim dibbartî ʿimmåkhem
English: And the LORD said unto Moses, Thus thou shalt say unto the children of Israel, Ye have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּן אִתִּ֑י אֱלֹ֤הֵי כֶ֨סֶף֙ וֵאלֹהֵ֣י זָהָ֔ב לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ לָכֶֽם׃
Translit: lōʾ thaʿasūn ʾittî ʾelōhē khesef vēʾlōhē zåhåv lōʾ thaʿasū låkhem
English: Ye shall not make with me gods of silver, neither shall ye make unto you gods of gold.

Hebrew: מִזְבַּ֣ח אֲדָמָה֮ תַּעֲשֶׂה־לִּי֒ וְזָבַחְתָּ֣ עָלָ֗יו אֶת־עֹלֹתֶ֨יךָ֙ וְאֶת־שְׁלָמֶ֔יךָ אֶת־צֹֽאנְךָ֖ וְאֶת־בְּקָרֶ֑ךָ בְּכָל־הַמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַזְכִּ֣יר אֶת־שְׁמִ֔י אָב֥וֹא אֵלֶ֖יךָ וּבֵרַכְתִּֽיךָ׃
Translit: mizbaḥ ʾadhåmåh taʿaseh-lî vəzåvaḥtå ʿålåv ʾeth-ʿōlōthekhå vəʾeth-shəlåmekhå ʾeth-tṣōʾnəkhå vəʾeth-bəqårekhå bəkhål-hammåqōm ʾasher ʾazkîr ʾeth-shəmî ʾåvōʾ ʾēlekhå ūvērakhtîkhå
English: An altar of earth thou shalt make unto me, and shalt sacrifice thereon thy burnt offerings, and thy peace offerings, thy sheep, and thine oxen: in all places where I record my name I will come unto thee, and I will bless thee.

Hebrew: וְאִם־מִזְבַּ֤ח אֲבָנִים֙ תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לִּ֔י לֹֽא־תִבְנֶ֥ה אֶתְהֶ֖ן גָּזִ֑ית כִּ֧י חַרְבְּךָ֛ הֵנַ֥פְתָּ עָלֶ֖יהָ וַתְּחַֽלְלֶֽהָ׃
Translit: vəʾim-mizbaḥ ʾavånîm taʿaseh-lî lōʾ-thivneh ʾethhen gåzîth kî ḥarbəkhå hēnaftå ʿålehå vattəḥallehå-
English: And if thou wilt make me an altar of stone, thou shalt not build it of hewn stone: for if thou lift up thy tool upon it, thou hast polluted it.

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תַעֲלֶ֥ה בְמַעֲלֹ֖ת עַֽל־מִזְבְּחִ֑י אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹֽא־תִגָּלֶ֥ה עֶרְוָתְךָ֖ עָלָֽיו׃
Translit: vəlōʾ-thaʿaleh vəmaʿalōth ʿal-mizbəḥî ʾasher lōʾ-thiggåleh ʿervåthkhå ʿålåv-
English: Neither shalt thou go up by steps unto mine altar, that thy nakedness be not discovered thereon.
